metadata.title: CVE-2023-52746 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:xfrm/compat: prevent potential spectre v1 gadget in xfrm_xlate32_attr() inttype = nla_type(nla); if (type > XFRMA_MAX) { return -EOPNOTSUPP; } @typeis then used as an array index and can be used as a Spectre v1 gadget. if(nla_len(nla) < compat_policy[type].len) { array_index_nospec() can be usedto prevent leaking content of kernel memory to malicious users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
